p: “Interestingly, we found that the most dominant genus Cladosporium (OTU287) showed a positive relationship with Didymellaceae in the canopy air of A. adenophora. This pattern here does not mean that Cladosporium specifically facilitates the accumulation of Didymellaceae in the air but mirrors the high prevalence of Cladosporium spores in the air [55, 56].” (Lines 448-452)
